name: Domaine de Rhodes

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here two nights during our honeymoon. Our room was gorgeous! Pink tones all over with 19th and early 20th century touches. The bed was comfortable, the views were lovely and the service was excellent. Breakfast is great and the owners are very warm and friendly. Also, the location is excellent for exploring Provance. I love it.
reviews.title: I love it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: This was a lovely place to stay, but it was not what I was seeking. Most of the folks staying there really loved it. Some were returning guests. The house is filled with antiques. The rooms are quaint. The owners are extremely helpful. Breakfasts are excellent.
reviews.title: A beautiful place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What didn't I like? I would have preferred an in-town hotel. The hotel is ten minutes or so outside of Avignon. It is a mildly confusing ride back and forth, and parking in Avignon isn't always convenient.
reviews.title: Charming place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although atniques are quaint, I did not prefer the footed bathtub and old-style fixtures. Give me a modern bathroom anytime.
reviews.title: The perfect B&B in Avignon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012
reviews.text: We stayed five nights in late August and had a very enjoyable time. Totally agreed with all the positive feedback from other travelers. Would like to highlight the following:
reviews.title: Authentic, warm and inviting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent five nights with Francoise and Paco and they could not have done anything else to make our stay more enjoyable. The location of the property is perfect – when you walk around the old town of Avignon and see the parking situation, it is with an enormous relief that you realise you have picked the best location. Only a few minutes from the town to one side of the river and another few minutes to Villeneuve de Avignon on the other. Wide open spaces, plenty of parking and the only noise at night was the 'hoo-ing' of the owls.
reviews.title: Perfect location, wonderful hosts, fabulous house... we could have stayed forever.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The house is warm and inviting and the lounge area is the perfect place to wind down after a day touring. Comfortable, leather lounges that you sink into and relax while reading or catching up on a bit or work (sometimes a necessary evil).
reviews.title: So very perfect!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfasts were a delight and Francoise and Paco showed great warmth in sharing it with the guests each morning. They are a wealth of information about the area and their recommendations for restaurants (AOC and Basta Cosi) were wonderful. We were lucky to share out stay with MargoC (below) and thoroughly enjoyed the company. This is what makes B&Bs special and Domaine de Rhodes is an exceptional example of why we continue to choose this type of accommodation.
reviews.title: Rural charm across the bridge from Avignon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One of the most appealing features of the property is the spaciousness – we stayed in Matisse which was enormous, with plenty of hanging and cupboard space. We were able to make ourselves at home and Francoise was so accommodating in showing us where everything was, to ensure our stay was as comfortable as possible.
reviews.title: A dream come true

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The only disappointment was having to leave.... we could have spent five weeks in the area. Thank you Francoise and Paco, the perfect hosts.
reviews.title: Wonderful find in Avignon!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Others have praised Domaine de Rhodes and we join them. If there was an ideal model of the perfect host and hostess of a B & B, Francoise and Paco would be IT. They provided the finest breakfasts in all of our 3 1/2 week stay in Province and Paris. Breakfast with the multi-national guests was lively, informative and a highlight of our day. Our room was roomy, clean and charming with a wonderful view overlooking the front gardens. Just note that as it is located on an island on the Rhone, driving to dinner is necessary. If you're coming to Avignon, this is the place to stay.
reviews.title: THE place to stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed for two weeks in the small but perfect cottage called Studio Renoir. We had the best France holiday ever thanks to Francoise and Paco who are lovely hosts. The location is quiet - on a small island off central Avignon - and convenient for exploring Provence.
reviews.title: Perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our cottage was fully equipped with a stove, fridge, microwave and all of the necessary plates, glasses and cutlery etc. It was quiet and spotlessly clean and the aircon worked perfectly. Being a bit of a 'princess and the petit pois' and liking a softer mattress, I had a challenging time sleeping on the ultra hard mattress (I hasten to add that this is not unlike other places I have stayed in Europe). Francoise and Paco did their best to help out and I eventually appropriated our outdoor chair cushions and found this an excellent solution.
reviews.title: A Quiet Place in the Country
Attention to Detail!
reviews.text: We had a small television in our room and we did watch it on occasion as the Olympics were on, but also enjoyed going into the main lounge and watching more coverage on the television or on our computer - no wifi in our cottage, but we didn't mind. We met other Brits who couldn't bear to miss watching Andy Murray win a gold medal.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were travelling with our Canadian friends who have two small children. They stayed in the beautiful and well appointed Cezanne apartment and we cooked on the electric BBQ and ate sitting on their terrace many nights. On the days where we were all just too tired to go out, we sat by the swimming pool and relaxed. Francoise and Paco went out of their way to make all of us feel welcome and I can confidently say that Domaine de Rhodes is very child friendly.
reviews.title: Central yet secluded, professional service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from an eight night stay with Françoise and Paco at their B&B near Avignon, France. The experience was nothing less than amazing. The old hunting lodge built in the 1600s has been tastefully updated while maintaining the look and feel of the original. The rooms were large well decorated and clean. The grounds are full of trees and with tastefully place tables and chairs perfect for romantic diners by the moon light. We were greeted each morning by Françoise and Paco at the common breakfast table in the main lodge. Here we shared the previous days travel stories and planned the day’s journeys. Our hostesses were eager to guide us to the local restaurants and sightseeing locations around the area. If there was a down side to the experience it was that we had to leave.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay in Provence

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: This postcard-perfect building is even better than the photos when you arrive in person. We absolutely loved everything about this place, from the beautiful common areas, to the warm welcome and delicious breakfast! The grounds are incredible (and quite large) and the pool was wonderful. We loved the courtyard under the giant trees where we could enjoy an afternoon glass of wine in the breezy shade! The hosts were as good as they get! Francoise and Paco were so friendly, working with our broken American-French and really working hard to make sure we had a great stay. The rooms were comfortable and lovely. I really appreciated the open space to linger and enjoy. So often while traveling, it can feel you are confined to one room or to sit on a bed. This place feels like the home you wish you had!
reviews.title: Breathtakingly beautiful, warm & welcoming!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only difficult part about staying at the Domaine is getting to the location the first time. I hope they put up more readable signs at the corners on the main traffic circles. Also note that it's very difficult to take a taxi into the city and back in the evening, so plan on driving to dinner or picnicking.
reviews.title: Fabulous stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I just spent 6 days at Domaine de Rhodes for our honeymoon and we loved every minute of it. Françoise & Paco are very nice and always ready to offer suggestions on where to eat or places to go.
reviews.title: Charming

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The B&B grounds are so beautiful - outdoor eating areas, an outdoor kitchen & fridge, swimming pool... they really thought of everything! The location is perfect - very peaceful and quiet. It's only a short drive to the main road leading to Avignon city center.
reviews.title: Such a wonderful place for couples

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Really amazing 400 year old Chateau. Great rooms, sitting rooms, dining room-all country style comfy. Breakfast were excellent. Only sorry I wasn't there during warm weather to use the pool.
reviews.title: In the country-yet 8 mins from the walled city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here in September for 2 nights. Do not be fooled by the location - it was only 5/10 mins by taxi into the centre of Avignon. In exchange you stay in a fabulous old shooting lodge in substantial grounds with a lovely swimming pool to cool down in at the end of the day. The building has loads of character, our bedroom and bathroom were delightful with big shuttered windows overlooking the front. The housekeeping was excellent as was the hospitality. The breakfasts are wonderful and everyone sits at one big table. Francoise and Paco are very welcoming hosts and nothing was too much trouble including organising taxis for us. At the end of a busy noisy day in Avignon, this is a delight to return to. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Paradise!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: This B&B is in an old elegant house in a country setting, and is just across the bridge from Avignon. It was very nice to stay outside the city and be able drive into the city and park at a parking deck within easy walking distance of all the sights. The innkeepers speak English.
reviews.title: Wonderful setting in the country on the island in the river across the bridge from Avignon.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I just spent 3 gorgeous days in Avignon at the Domaine de Rhodes B&B. It's a beautiful place, quiet, clean and the owners Francoise and Paco are extremely warm and friendly, they made us feel at home! We awoke every morning to a tasty breakfast of croissants, local jams and jellies, yogurt and freshly made French pressed cafe.
reviews.title: Great place to stay in Avignon!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are looking for a place to stay in Avignon this is it, look no further.
reviews.title: Going to Provence? You Must Stay Here!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Our family of five stayed in the Cezanne apartment at Domaine de Rhodes for a week in late December and looked forward to arriving back to a warm and cosy "home" after visiting the magnificent countryside of Provence. The bedrooms were generous and the hot showers rejuvenated us after walking all day. Françoise and Paco gave us helpful tips about places to visit and where to eat. The whisper quiet location is amazingly only 5 minutes from Avignon town centre.
reviews.title: Calm & Cosy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Merci beaucoup Françoise et Paco pour un séjour inoubliable!
reviews.title: Earns its #1 status

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011
reviews.text: I stayed in this property during the low season right after Christmas. We were the only ones staying in the main house so we felt like we lived in our own mansion. The decor is stately and beautiful. The holiday decorations were tasteful and festive. Francoise and Paco greeted us warmly and gave us a tour and explained the breakfast hours. A fire was blazing upon our arrival and we enjoyed sitting in front of it and relaxing.
reviews.title: A home away from home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The table was set beautifully in the morning for breakfast. A very nice display of fresh breads, fresh orange juice, jams, cereal and yogurt were offered. Francoise and Paco had family visiting for the holidays and we enjoyed meeting them as well. Everyone was very warm.
reviews.title: Terrific Place to Stay in Avignon!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We only had one day to tour Avignon so we chose not to rent a car. I do believe a car is necessary if you plan to use this as a base for travels, which I highly recommend! The taxi cost from the train was around 20Euro and the return pick up and drop of to the train was around 30 Euro as they charged for coming out for the pick up. Francoise had business in town so she was kind enough to offer to drive us in to town herself after breakfast. What a wonderful treat! She even gave us an impromptu tour.
reviews.title: wonderful experience
Wish we'd stayed a week
reviews.text: The only problem with this charming 16th century farmhouse is that it may tempt you not to explore Provence. Françoise and Paco are charming and very helpful, their breakfasts are amazing, their English is good, the house is lovely, and the rooms are large and comfortable, and decorated attractively. I only wish we'd stayed longer.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 6 nights in a lovingly restored hunting lodge on the Isle de Barthelasse in October. Our hosts, Francoise and Paco, were very gracious and accommodating. The breakfasts were wonderful - cereals, granola, flaky croissants & other pastries, fresh fruit, cheese, homemade fruit preserves, homemade yogurt, juices and excellent coffee & tea. The advice on travel in the area, the interest of the hosts in our plans for the day, the feeling of camaraderie they created, the luxurious rooms and the peaceful surroundings all made this an enjoyable place to stay.
reviews.title: Peaceful, Secluded B & B,Gracious Hosts Avignon France

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They have done a wonderful job of restoring this old lodge, even using some of the antiques handed down to Francoise by her family.
reviews.title: Perfect stay in a stunning B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We chose to stay in the Vilar room, very spacious and luxurious, at the top of a spiral staircase. It had air conditioning, a sitting room, lovely views out over the property and a modern bathroom that was supplied with L'Occitaine products, a large bathtub, a modern tiled shower with a rain shower head, a towel warmer and crystal chandeliers! Our linens, both bed and bathroom, were changed daily! And, when I asked about doing laundry somewhere in the area, Francoise did it for us and did not even charge for that service. She said she did it out of lover for her guests!
reviews.title: Beautiful B&B!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You will need a car to tour the area of Provence and a GPS is a must. In fact, you probably will not find the Domaine without a GPS; so many small roads and lanes. But, once you find it, "ooh la la"!
reviews.title: Lovely area to visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: Francoise and Paco have turned a charming Provence farmhouse into a wonderful French Chateau. Staying here was one of our favorite experiences of our vacation in the south of France. The hosts are accommodating and friendly and the rooms and common areas of the house are comfortable, spacious and filled with furniture and art that is beautiful and timeless. The location is great for exploring Provence, although a car is a requirement as it is a 5 minute drive from town. The breakfasts were excellent, consisting of local food and good conversation with the other guests. A good value for what you get. We wished we had more time to spend just relaxing in this great space!
reviews.title: Unforgettable Provence experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were very happy with every aspect of this chamber d'hôtel . The location was great for seeing Avignon and all the surrounding sites in Provence. The owners take great pride in their hotel and providing great service. We definitely recommend staying there.
reviews.title: Great accommodation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Take the wine tour from David, it is excellent.
reviews.title: Enchanting~Magical...a restful respite
Super nice couple with comfortable apartment
reviews.text: Avignon in and itself is a fairy tale type of place to visit in the south of France. Our objective was to meander from Burgundy to Provence to Nice to the Italian Riviera by car over a 3.5 week period. Our stop at Domaine de Rhodes exceeded our expectations completely! Located just minutes away from the medieval walled city of Avignon, the farmhouse and other connected buildings are situated in the middle of several acres of open fields and wooded glens. The rooms ooze a historical past yet are very cozy, clean and well appointed (not to mention quite spacious!) Each morning was a delightful time to visit with Francoise and Paco over breakfast and they were quite earnest in learning the interests of all their guests and making helpful suggestions for day excursions. Our interest was ancient Roman ruins and wine tasting and there was plenty of each to explore within an hours circumference of Avignon. Wow....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Its been 15 months since we were there last--my review is overdue but I find myself dreaming of returning and hence, I am writing this to say---"see you soon!" We were actually there in September of 2011...the weather was EXQUISITE--and post tourist high season. Delightful!
reviews.title: An overdue review of a wonderful place!

description: At the foot of Avignon's city walls, the île de la Barthelasse is a haven of peace, greenery and freshness. Here in the shade of hundred year old plane tees, in the heart of 1 hectare of grounds, Domaine de Rhodes, a farmer 16th century hunting lodge, offers several choices of accomodations for your stay in the region: for a night, a week-end or week. We propose you: guest houses of charm been looked after, character and authenticity. Cottages which will remind you Provence of former days. An apartment sophisticated and decorated carefully.
